CodeItem.stability_definition: Metal closure that is designed or constructed to be significantly difficult for children under five years of age to open and not difficult for normal adults to use properly.
Plastic closure that is designed or constructed to be significantly difficult for children under five years of age to open and not difficult for normal adults to use properly.
Metal closure turned onto a corresponding thread on the top or mouth of a container, whether it be glass, plastic or metal.
Plastic closure turned onto a corresponding thread on the top or mouth of a container, whether it be glass, plastic or metal.

A non-threaded shallow draw metal closure that normally has 21 corrugations on the outer edge, which function to engage the container when applied. The crown is only 1/4" high when manufactured and does not have a rolled edge or wire. The crown is manufactured in 26mm worldwide and can be applied to either a threaded finish or a solid ring pry-off finish.
A hinged single or dual flap closure for controlled product dispensing.
A closure with a lid that is hinged to the top of a closure and opens to expose a dispensing orifice.

A closure that incorporates a specific molded-in feature such as rings, plugs or flexible sections. These features achieve a seal by conforming to one or more of the sealing surfaces on the container neck finish.

Closure with an ability to be applied and removed with a partial turn. The closure can also be produced with vacuum buttons that can clearly indicate to the packer if a vacuum has been effectively drawn following the closure application.
A metal/plastic composite cap composed of a plastisol lined metal disk, assembled to a plastic band. The closure requires a simple glass bead finish common on bowls, tumblers and carafes.

Closure with a stepped, skirted drawn shell with an inside curl. The closure is lined with an annular plastisol material designed to provide a proper seal along the top and side surfaces of the glass container finish. The closure uses a special plastisol material that, following application, takes a permanent impression of the glass threads ensuring cam-off and reseal.
Closure dispensing pumps are used to dispense product from containers.

A two-piece dispensing closure that includes a base member the lower portion of which is designed to attach and seal securely to a container finish and the upper portion of which is designed to receive a dispensing spout member. The spout member may be moved upward and downward to open and close the dispensing passageway.

A tamper-evident closure produced as an unthreaded shell containing a liner. It is applied to the proper finish on a plastic or glass container by the bottler, using a roll-on capping machine that forms a thread in the closure matching the bottle thread.
A non-threaded closure that is pressed onto the package finish with a protruding feature that mates with a similar protruding feature on the closure to secure the closure to the package.
Conical closure that is turned onto a container. The tip is cut off to open the container.
Object used to plug opening of container.

Composite tamper-evident closures usually consist of a metal disk with a plastic skirt. The plastic skirt is perforated or weakened in some manner so that when the closure is removed, this section is designed to break and either remain on the container or attached to the closure to indicate the package has been opened.

A closure/finish of a closure/container system designed to make it difficult to achieve the first removal of a closure from a container without it being detectable by subsequent users that the package seal has been breached (e.g., aluminum overseal).
A closure that shows the package has been opened and the product has been exposed to the outside environment.
Line, ribbon, or cord used for fastening, or drawing the container closed.

A closure with a lower part attaches securely and seals the container. The upper part provides a second movable portion which functions in a rocker-like pivotal motion between an open and a closed position.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Trigger Spray Dispensing Plastic Container Closure
CodeItem.stability_definition: Closure designed to dispense product from containers by spraying the product when a trigger is pulled.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Twist Open/Close Dispensing Plastic Container Closure
CodeItem.stability_definition: Two-piece dispensing closure that has a lower portion designed to attach and seal securely to a container finish and the upper portion of which is designed to receive a dispensing spout member. Rotating the spout member opens and closed the container.
Metal/Plastic closures used on packages where the pressure inside the package is less than atmospheric.
Metal closures used on packages where the pressure inside the package is less than atmospheric.
Plastic closures used on packages where the pressure inside the package is less than atmospheric.

Dispensing closure incorporating a product-flow controlling valve within the orifice. Product will not dispense from the package until sufficient squeezing pressure is applied to the flexible container to cause the valve to open.

CodeItem.nci_definition: A container capable of being hermetically sealed, intended to hold sterile materials.
A pre-filled non-injectable pipette, syringe or tube.
A sac or pouch.

A package that consists of molded plastic or laminate that has indentations (viewed as 'blisters' when flipped) into which a dosage form, is placed. A covering, usually of laminated material, is then sealed to the molded part. A strip pack is a specialized type of blister pack where there are no pre-formed or molded parts; in this case there are two flexible layers that are sealed with the dosage form in between. Suppositories that are strip packed between two layers of foil are also considered a blister pack.
A vessel with a narrow neck designed to accept a specific closure.
A bottle that is used by the pharmacist to dispense the prescribed medication. It includes preparations for which a dropper accompanies the bottle.

A bottle that has a device specifically intended for the application of a liquid in a drop by drop manner, or a device intended for the delivery of an exact dose (e.g., calibrated dropper for oral medications).
A glass vessel with a narrow neck designed to accept a specific closure.
A plastic vessel with a narrow neck designed to accept a specific closure.
A bottle that is fitted with a pumping mechanism for the administration of drug product.
A bottle that is fitted with an atomizer or a device which produces finely divided liquid carried by air.
A bottle that contains a single whole dose of a non-parenteral drug product.
A bottle which includes a device for applying its contents.
A square or rectangular vessel, usually made of cardboard or plastic.

A box that contains a single dose of a non-parenteral drug product. [Note: Boxes that contain 100 unit dose blister packs should be classified under blister pack, since this is the immediate container into which the dosage form is placed.]
A cylindrical vessel, usually made of metal.
A type of can for holding a drug product.

CodeItem.stability_definition: A type of lined can for holding a drug product.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A round container that has an inner layer of a material different from what the canister is composed of.

A drug packaging type usually in a cylindrical shape with rounded ends. Capsule shells may be made from gelatin, starch, or cellulose, or other suitable materials, may be soft or hard, and are filled with solid or liquid drug products.
A cardboard box or container which is usually considered a secondary packaging component.

A container consisting of a cylinder with a septum at one end, and a seal at the other end, which is inserted into a device to form a syringe which contains a single dose of a parenteral drug product.
A receptacle for holding something (e.g., that into which some oral contraceptive blister packs are placed).
A plastic 'clamshell' [thin plastic pre-formed structure for a device].
An object that can be used to hold things.
A bowl-shaped container.
A cup intended to hold a single dose of a non-parenteral drug product.
A container designed specifically to hold gases.

A container, usually made of glass or metal, that has at least two walls with the space between each wall evacuated so as to prevent the transfer of heat. The inside of the container often has a coating (as silvering) on the inside to reduce heat transfer, and is used especially for storing liquified gases or for experiments at low temperatures. The size can vary from that of a small thermos bottle up to that which may be mounted upon a large truck (also known as a 'cryogenic truck').

A dose pack container designed to assist with patient compliance. The patient turns a dial to the correct day and the correct dose is made available and the container indicates that the dose has been removed.

CodeItem.stability_definition: A shallow dish with a loose-fitting cover.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A shallow dish with a lid used to culture cells.
A container in which a preselected dose or dose regimen of the medication is placed.
A straight-sided cylindrical shipping container with flat ends; one of which can be opened/closed.

CodeItem.stability_definition: Flat bottom bottle, container or vessel.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A container with a base wider than the narrow neck traditionally used for holding liquids.

A receptacle with a body constructed of film, woven plastic, woven fabric, paper or combination thereof, together with any appropriate service equipment and handling devices, and if necessary, an inner coating or liner.
A device by means of which a medicinal product can be administered by inspiration through the nose or the mouth.
A container of medication intended to refill an inhaler.
A rigid container having a wide mouth and often no neck which typically holds solid or semisolid drug products.
A large, deep container that has a narrow mouth, is typically fitted with a handle, and is used to hold liquids.
A packaged set of related pharmaceutical or and/or drug delivery devices used for a particular medical activity or procedure including required documentation for kit components and the entire kit.
The package type is not stated or is unavailable.
The drug product container with any accompanying materials or components. This may include the protective packaging, labeling, administration devices, etc.
A package in which two or more drug products that are normally available separately are now available together.

An envelope into which only one dose of a drug product, usually in the form of granules or powder, has been directly placed. An example includes glassine powder paper containing aspirin. Other examples include aluminum foil packets into which alcohol swabs and pledgets are placed.
A watertight vessel, often cylindrical, that is usually fitted with a handle, and that may have a lid.

A drug delivery system that often contains an adhesive backing that is usually applied to an external site on the body. Its ingredients either passively diffuse from, or are actively transported from, some portion of the patch. Depending upon the patch, the ingredients are either delivered to the outer surface of the body or into the body.

CodeItem.stability_definition: Small volume multi-chambered plate (e.g. 96 well).
CodeItem.nci_definition: A flat dish type device with multiple wells for testing cellular material.

A flexible container used to protect or hold one or more doses of a drug product (e.g. a pouch into which oral contraceptive blister packs are inserted, and an overwrap pouch for large volume parenterals).
A multilayer paper bag for shipping some solid bulk excipients, usually in the form of powder or granules.

A device for the administration of parenteral drug products that consists of a rigid barrel fitted with septum with a plunger at one end and a seal or needle at the other end. The needle assembly may be part of the device or separate.

A device for the administration of parenteral drug products that consists of a rigid glass barrel fitted with septum with a plunger at one end and a seal or needle at the other end. The needle assembly may be part of the device or separate.

A device for the administration of parenteral drug products that consists of a rigid plastic barrel fitted with septum with a plunger at one end and a seal or needle at the other end. The needle assembly may be part of the device or separate.
A specialized package; it registers each time it is opened and is used for checking patient compliance to prescribed medication regimens.
A large receptacle used for holding, transporting, or storing liquids or gases, and often referred to as a reservoir.

A shallow flat receptacle, with a raised edge or rim, used for carrying, holding, or displaying finished drug product in its primary or market package. A tray and its contents may be encased in shrink-wrapped plastic for shipping, or with a cover or an overwrap as part of a unit of use package or kit.
A flexible container for semisolid drug products which is flattened and crimped or sealed at one end and has a reclosable opening at the other.
A tube which is provided with a device (the applicator) for administering the dosage form. The applicator may be part of the tube closure or be separate.
A container designed for use with parenteral drug products.
A vial that is used by the pharmacist to dispense the prescribed medication.
A glass container designed for use with parenteral drug products.
A vial intended to contain more than one dose of the drug product.
A vial that has a patented delivery system.

A container of a sterile preparation whose contents are intended for use in a pharmacy admixture program and are restricted to the preparation of admixtures for infusion or, through a sterile transfer device, for the filling of empty sterile syringes.
A vial that contains a parenteral preparation that can be attached directly to the tubing of a parenterally administered fluid.
A plastic container designed for use with parenteral drug products.
A vial containing a single unit of a parenteral drug product.
A vial where a single dose of a parenteral drug product can be removed, and then the vial and its remaining contents can be disposed.

CodeItem.stability_definition: The closure system of the container.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Closure Systems within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.stability_definition: As reported entity or as part of a reported packaged product, this is the official code for a referenced package type. For FDA implementation, only the display Name (i.e., the product name is mandatory, the code values might be provided if available).
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Container Types within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.stability_definition: This code describes the form of the reported product. Code values might be provided if available (e.g., when used in other submissions like SPL).
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Product Forms within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.stability_definition: This is the code for the official product name. For FDA implementation, only the "displayName" (i.e., the product name) is mandatory, the code values might be provided if available (e.g., when used in other submissions like SPL). For NDA this is a new identifier. For ongoing studies the identifier should be identical to an already submitted code, so that a unique relationship can be established.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Product Identifiers within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Stability Study Data File Reason Terminology
CodeItem.stab_pt: Stability Study Data File Reason Terminology
CodeItem.stability_definition: This code should indicate the type of application the data supports or whether the data is submitted to an existing application. The codes indicate that the data is part of an Annual Report, New Drug Application, New Active Ingredient, Biologics License Application, Premarket Approval, or Supplement to an Approved Application.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Data File Reasons within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Stability Study Data File Type Terminology
CodeItem.stab_pt: Stability Study Data File Type Terminology
CodeItem.stability_definition: This code should reflect if the file in hand is a standard data file for one storage condition or a partial file as part of a cycled study.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Data File Types within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.stability_definition: For a single acceptance criterion (i.e., limit) this code describes how to relate the given value to a measured value, (e.g., a result should not be greater (not more) than the given value). The common accepted nomenclature should be used here.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Study Interpretations within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.stability_definition: A classification of the methods used in stability testing.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Study Method Types within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.stability_definition: This code describes any delay that happened during testing, e.g. none (Immediate) or freeze sample (Delayed Frozen).
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Pause Descriptions within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.stability_definition: The code provided represents a storage condition. Dependent of the internal company definitions this condition might be simple (e.g., 25 degrees) or complex (e.g., 25 degrees C/60% R.H. upright).
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Storage Conditions within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.stability_definition: This code describes the test performed during a study within the specification sheet.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Study Tests within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.stability_definition: This code classifies the type of study performed on the given Research Subject, e.g., Commercial, Development, Clinical.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Study Types within the Stability Data Standards.

CodeItem.stability_definition: The official code for a referenced substance (e.g., acetylsalicylic acid), as a single entity or part of a product (e.g., aspirin). For FDA implementation, only the displayName (i.e. the product name) is mandatory, the code values might be provided if available (e.g., when used in other submissions like SPL), please refer to Substance Registration System - Unique Ingredient Identifier (UNII), at http://www.fda.gov/oc/datacouncil/spl.html. If you have a new compound that is not in the Substance Registration System (SRS) it can be registered by contacting fda-srs(at)fda.hhs.gov. The compound can be given a code and the other information about the compound can remain confidential.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Terminology developed to support Substance Identifiers within the Stability Data Standards.
Contents packaged under pressure that are released upon activation of an appropriate valve system.
A foam that is packaged under pressure and released upon activation of an appropriate valve system.
An aerosol contained in a device with valves that permits the release of a specified quantity of active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon activation.
A powder composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) and packaged under pressure. Ingredients are released upon activation of an appropriate valve system.
A spray that is packaged under pressure and released upon activation of an appropriate valve system.
A bar designed to be chewed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A solid in the shape of a small sphere.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Extended Release Bead Implant Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A solid in the shape of a small sphere intended to be embedded securely in the body and designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A solid or semi-solid in the shape of a square or rectangle.
A solid contained within either a hard or soft soluble shell, usually prepared from gelatin.
A capsule that contains an additional outer layer over the capsule shell.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Coated Pellet in Capsule Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A capsule composed of small globular masses covered with an outer shell.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Extended Release Coated Capsule Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A capsule covered with a thin layer of substance and is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A capsule covered with a substance that is designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Delayed Release Pellet in Capsule Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A capsule composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) small, spherical structures that have been coated with a substance that is designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.
A capsule designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Extended Release Film Coated Capsule Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A capsule covered with a thin layer of water soluble or insoluble polymer and is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A capsule covered with a thin layer of gelatin.
A capsule composed of liquid covered with an outer shell, which is usually prepared from gelatin.
A base composed of bonding agents intermingled with active and/or inert ingredient(s), which rapidly hardens into a firm mass upon application.
A solid composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) wrapped in a paper cylinder whereby one end is burned. The ingredient is released in a smoke form, which is inhaled.
A solid composed active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a woven absorbent material.
A solution or suspension composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) with increased strength in a reduced volume, which is usually diluted prior to administration.
A solid with a shape bounded by a circular base converging upon a single vertex.

A solid or liquid core composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) enclosed by a polymer coated shell. It is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A semi-solid composed of an emulsion of lipids, hydrocarbons, waxes, or polyols in water.
A cream that is modified to enhance the release of active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A solid that consists of naturally produced angular solids composed of singular, repeating units that are systematically arranged in an evenly spaced lattice.
A dome-shaped insert with a springy, flexible rim intended to be inserted into the vagina and positioned behind the pelvic bone to completely cover the cervix.
A flat, circular shaped form composed of a solid or powder that contains active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A substance intended for use as a vaginal irrigant.
A substance intended for administration in or on a wound.
Modern technology, distributed with or as a part of a drug product that allows for the uniform release or targeting of drugs to the body.
A solution composed of a clear, sweetened hydroalcoholic liquid in which active and/or inert ingredient(s) are dissolved.
A semi-solid composed of at least two immiscible liquids, one of which is dispersed as droplets within the other liquid, and stabilized with one or more emulsifying agents.
A solution or suspension intended for administration into the rectum.
A distillate composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) extracted from plant or animal matter, and represented in concentrated form.
A solid in the shape of a slender, elongated thread that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A thin layer of water soluble or insoluble polymer intended to coat the site of administration.
A film that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A film that will dissolve in a liquid solvent to form a solution.
A substance intended for administration as a solution.
A substance intended for administration as a suspension.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Extended Release Dosage Form for Suspension
CodeItem.nci_definition: A substance that forms a suspension upon reconstitution and designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
An elastic aeriform fluid in which the molecules are separated from one another and have freedom of movement.
A semi-solid composed of a solid, three dimensional, cross linked matrix of polymers within a liquid, yielding a jelly-like material unable to flow at steady state.
A gel intended for use in the oral cavity to clean the teeth and maintain oral hygiene.
A gel contained in a device with valves that permits the release of a uniform dose of gel that composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon activation.
An apparatus that converts solutions, suspensions or solids, composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) into a vapor or gas by heat or chemical reaction.
A solid composed of sucrose, lactose or other polysaccharides formed into small globular pellets impregnated with active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A solid composed of a piece of skin or other tissue intended for implantation into or on the body.
A solid composed of small particles or grains.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Delayed Release Granule for Suspension Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A pharmaceutical dosage form comprised of delayed release granules designed to form a suspension.
A solid composed of small particles or grains and have been coated with a substance that is designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.
A granule composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s), and a mixture of acids and sodium bicarbonate, which release carbon dioxide when dissolved in water.
A solid in the shape of a small particle or grain designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A granule intended for administration as a solution.
A granule intended for administration as a suspension.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Extended Release Granule for Suspension Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A granule intended for administration as a suspension and designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A semi-solid composed of a sticky, mucilaginous polysaccharide.
A semi-solid composed of synthetic, polymerized polysaccharide and flavorings, intended to be chewed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A semi-solid composed of a mixture of gum and a plant based hydrocarbon.
A solid intended for insertion securely within the body.
Vaporized active and/or inert ingredient(s) intended for administration by inhalation.
A substance composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) encapsulated in liposomes and intended for injection.
A substance intended for injection.
An emulsion intended for injection.
A substance composed of complexed active and/or inert ingredient(s) with natural or synthetic lipids that is intended for injection.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Powder for Injectable Solution Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A powder intended for injection following reconstitution to form a solution.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Powder for Injectable Suspension Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A powder intended for injection following reconstitution to form a suspension.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Powder for Injectable Extended Release Suspension Dosage Form
CodeItem.stab_pt: INJECTION, POWDER, FOR SUSPENSION, EXTENDED RELEASE
CodeItem.nci_definition: A powder intended for injection following reconstitution to form a suspension that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Lyophilized Powder for Injectable Liposomal Suspension Dosage Form
CodeItem.stab_pt: INJECTION, POWDER, LYOPHILIZED, FOR LIPOSOMAL SUSPENSION
CodeItem.nci_definition: A freeze dried powder composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) encapsulated in liposomes and intended for injection following reconstitution with a suitable solvent to form a suspension.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Lyophilized Powder for Injectable Solution Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A freeze dried powder intended for injection following reconstitution with a suitable solvent to form a solution.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Lyophilized Powder for Injectable Suspension Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A freeze dried powder intended for injection following reconstitution with a suitable solvent to form a suspension.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Lyophilized Powder for Extended Release Injectable Suspension Dosage Form
CodeItem.stab_pt: INJECTION, POWDER, LYOPHILIZED, FOR SUSPENSION, EXTENDED RELEASE
CodeItem.nci_definition: A freeze dried powder intended for injection following reconstitution with a suitable solvent to form a suspension that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A solution intended for injection.
A concentrate which is usually diluted prior to administration by injection.
A suspension intended for injection.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Injectable Extended Release Suspension Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A suspension intended for injection that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A suspension composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) encapsulated in liposomes and intended for injection.
A suspension intended for injection and is sonicated while a gas is bubbled through the suspension resulting in the creation of microspheres by the solid particles.
A solid or semi-solid intended for administration within the body.
An insert designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Extended Release Intraruminal Device Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A pharmaceutical dosage form comprised of extended release agents for intraruminal administration.
A solid intended for placement within the uterine cavity where active and/or inert ingredient(s) are released from an apparatus at a controlled rate.
A solution or suspension used to bathe or flush open wounds or body cavities.

A semi-solid composed of suspensions of active and/or inert ingredient(s) in any type of highly viscous material, including gelatin or gel. The structural matrix of the jelly contains high levels of liquid.
A collection of unrelated materials that are used together to orchestrate dosage administration.
A resinous film-forming agent dissolved in a solvent or a calcium hydroxide suspension within a synthetic resin solution, which rapidly hardens into a firm mass upon administration.
A semi-solid with viscosity similar to that of a lotion, which is intended for topical use and must be rubbed into the site of administration to release the active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A solid or semi-solid with a waxy consistency in the shape of a stick and intended for use on the lips.
A substance in the fluid state of matter having no fixed shape but a fixed volume.
A solution or suspension that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A semi-solid composed of an oil in water emulsion, with lower viscosity than cream or gel.
A lotion that is modified to enhance the release of active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A lotion composed of anionic surfactant intended for administration to the hair or scalp.
A solid composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s), sweeteners, other flavorings and mucilage, intended for oral administration.
A solution or suspension intended for oral administration, for its deodorizing or antiseptic effects in the oral cavity. Usually, the mouthwash is swished around the mouth and expelled.
An indication that the dosage form is not relevant or appropriate.
A solution or suspension that is hydrophobic, soluble in organic solvents, and liquid at ambient temperature.
A semi-solid, viscous in texture, that may be composed of a variety of bases including hydrocarbons, emulsifiers or vegetable oils, and mixed with active and/or inert ingredient(s).
An ointment that is modified to enhance the release of active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A solid composed of a material that contains active and/or inert ingredient(s) which is intended to be placed in a cavity or depression within the body.
A semi-solid composed of a large proportion of solids and finely dispersed active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a fat-based vehicle.
A paste of mild abrasives, detergents, flavoring agents, binders, fluoride, and other active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A solid or semi-solid composed of a lozenge, that contains active and/or inert ingredient(s) that dissolves when sucked in the mouth.
A solid composed of an impermeable occlusive backing and a formulation matrix in which the active and/or inert ingredient(s) are dissolved or dispersed; possibly includes an adhesive layer.
A patch designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Electrically Controlled Extended Release Patch Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A patch that composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) whose release is controlled by electronic impulses that release ingredients at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A solid composed of a small granular or compressed mass that contains highly purified active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A pellet intended for insertion securely within the body.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Extended Release Coated Pellet Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A pellet covered with a thin layer of substance that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A pharmaceutical dosage form containing active substance(s) delivered via pendant.
A solid composed of a small, round object composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A semi-solid composed of a soft, smooth mass with relatively thick consistency and strong adhesiveness that becomes solid when dry.
A semi-solid composed of a soft, moist mass that is made by wetting an absorbent solid substance.
A solid composed of a mixture of dry, finely divided active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A powder composed of a mild abrasives, detergents, flavoring agents, binders, fluoride, and other active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A powder composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s), and a mixture of acids and sodium bicarbonate, which release carbon dioxide when dissolved in water.
A powder that yields a solution following reconstitution with an appropriate liquid.
A powder that forms a suspension when reconstituted with a liquid solution.
A pharmaceutical dosage form comprised of lyophilized powder.
A powder contained in a device with valves that permits the dispensing of active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon activation.
A solid composed active and/or inert ingredient(s) of in the shape of a hoop.
A solution or suspension intended for irrigation purposes.
A semi-solid composed of a thick, fat or wax-based ointment or cerate with a consistency somewhere between an ointment and a plaster.
A solution or suspension composed of an anionic surfactant and intended for administration to the hair and/or scalp.
A suspension composed of anionic surfactant and intended for administration to the hair and/or scalp.
A pharmaceutical dosage form comprised of paper that is smoked.
A pharmaceutical dosage form comprised of a stick that is smoked.
An anionic surfactant for cleansing.
A clear, homogeneous liquid composed of one or more chemical substances dissolved in a solvent or mixture of mutually miscible solvents.
A concentrate which is usually diluted prior to administration and exists as a solution in its final form.
A solution composed of an iced saline slurry with or without active and/or inert ingredient(s) intended to induce regional hypothermia from the point of administration.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Extended Release Gel Forming Solution Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A solution that becomes gelatinous upon administration and is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Gel Forming Drop Solution Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A solution intended for administration in a drop-wise fashion; it becomes gelatinous upon administration.
A solution intended for administration in a drop-wise fashion.
A solid composed of a porous, interlacing, absorbent, usually shape retaining material, such as cellulose wood fibers or plastic polymer form.
A solution or suspension composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) in oil or water, typically dispensed from an atomizer or nebulizer.
A spray contained in a device with valves that permits the dispensing of a specified quantity of active and/or inert ingredient(s) upon activation.
A spray composed of a suspension that contains active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A solid composed active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a long, slender cylindrical shape.
A solid composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a long narrow piece of material.
A solid or semi-solid composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a wax, fat or a glycerin gelatin jelly and that is conical or oval in shape. It is intended to be inserted into a body orifice.
A suppository that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
Insoluble solid particles composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) that are dispersed in a liquid.
A suspension that is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A suspension intended for administration in a drop-wise fashion.
A solid composed of fibrous strands of material that are used to bind wound edges together.
A solid composed of a small piece of absorbent material attached to one end of a small stick.
A solution or suspension composed of a viscid vehicle that contains a high concentration of sucrose or other sugars and active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A solid composed of a mixture of that active and/or inert ingredient(s) are pressed or compacted together, usually in the form of a relatively flat and round, square or oval shape.
A tablet designed to be chewed to release the active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A tablet whose outer shell is covered with a substance.
A tablet composed of a conglomerate of particles that contains active and/or inert ingredient(s) that have been individually covered with a coating.
A tablet that has been coated with a substance that is designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Delayed Release Particle Tablet Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A tablet composed of individual fragments have been coated with a substance that is designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.
A tablet composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s), and a mixture of acids and sodium bicarbonate, which release carbon dioxide when dissolved in water.
A tablet designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A tablet covered with a thin layer of water soluble or insoluble polymer.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Film Coated Extended Release Tablet Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A tablet covered with a thin layer of water soluble or insoluble polymer and is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A tablet that changes into a solution when added to a liquid solvent.
A tablet that changes into a suspension when added to a liquid solution.
A tablet composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) that have been compressed to form a tablet that contains multiple layers.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Multilayered Extended Release Tablet Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A tablet composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) that have been compressed into multiple layers and is designed to release active and/or inert ingredient(s) at a controlled, prolonged rate so as to reduce dosing frequency.
A tablet which disintegrates and dissolves quickly (usually within a matter of seconds) in the mouth. Additional water to complete dissolution is not necessary.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Orally Disintegrating Delayed Release Tablet Dosage Form
CodeItem.nci_definition: A tablet that disintegrates rapidly, usually within a matter of seconds, when placed upon the tongue but is also designed to impede the immediate release of the active and/or inert ingredient(s) after administration.
A tablet that will dissolve in a liquid solvent to form a solution.
A tablet covered with sugar.
A pharmaceutical dosage form containing active substance(s) that are delivered via a tag device.
A solid composed of a plug made from absorbent material.
A solid composed of narrow woven fabric or a narrow extruded synthetic material, usually with an adhesive on one or both sides.
A solution composed of an alcoholic extract or solution of nonvolatile active and/or inert ingredient(s).
A solid discoid composed of active and/or inert ingredient(s) in a suitably flavored base, that dissolves when sucked in the mouth.
An indication that the dosage form has yet to be assigned.
A solid composed of a thin slice of material that contain active and/or inert ingredient(s).

SubsetItem.subset_name: Stability Study Data File Reason Terminology

CodeItem.stability_definition: Stability data submitted to an annual report or update to an approved application.
Stability data submitted to a biologics license application.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A formal submission to FDA from any legal person or entity to obtain permission for manufacturing and marketing a biological product subject to licensure under section 351 of the Public Health Service Act. A biologics license application must contains specific information on the manufacturing processes, chemistry, pharmacology, clinical pharmacology and the medical affects of the biologic product, sufficient for the FDA to determine that the establishment and the product meet applicable requirements to ensure the continued safety, purity, and potency of the product, including but not limited to GMPs.

CodeItem.stability_definition: Stability data submitted for an HDE application.
CodeItem.nci_definition: A premarket submission to FDA for a device intended to benefit patients by treating or diagnosing a condition affecting fewer than 4,000 individuals in the United States per year. An HDE is similar in form and content to a premarket approval (PMA) but is exempt from the effectiveness requirements of a PMA.

CodeItem.stability_definition: Stability data submitted to an investigational device exemption.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Allows an investigational device to be used in a clinical study in order to collect safety and effectiveness data required to support a Premarket Approval application or a Premarket Notification submission to the Food and Drug Administration.

CodeItem.stability_definition: Stability data submitted to an investigational new animal drug file.
Stability data submitted to an investigational new human drug application.
Stability data submitted for an active ingredient, could be stability data for an active ingredient submitted in a drug application, or a Master File.
Stability data submitted to a new animal drug application.
Stability data submitted to a new human drug application.
Stability data submitted for a PMA application.
Stability data submitted to an approved application already filed with the FDA.

SubsetItem.subset_name: Stability Study Data File Type Terminology

CodeItem.stability_definition: A Cycled study would be a one time freeze/thaw study.
A Photostability study would be a one time study.
A Standard stability study would be a long term or accelerated stability study for either a finished product or active ingredient.
This is equivalent to does not meet requirements or specifications.
CodeItem.nci_definition: Having undergone failure; did not accomplish the intended purpose.

CodeItem.stability_definition: The value should not be greater than the given value excluding the given value, which is equivalent to "less than".
CodeItem.nci_definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.

CodeItem.stability_definition: The value should not be smaller than the given value excluding the given value, which is equivalent to "greater than".
CodeItem.nci_definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.

CodeItem.stability_definition: If a value for test has to be provided, but has no given criteria (e.g., the result is for "report only" or "monitoring").
CodeItem.nci_definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

CodeItem.stability_definition: The value should not be smaller than the given value and includes the given value, which is equivalent to "greater than or equal to".
CodeItem.nci_definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.

CodeItem.stability_definition: The value should not be greater than the given value and includes the given value, which is equivalent to "less than or equal to".
CodeItem.nci_definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.

CodeItem.stability_definition: This is equivalent to meets requirements or specifications.
CodeItem.nci_definition: One of two possible results of a pass/fail assessment; when the result satisfies a condition.

CodeItem.stability_definition: Method dictated by CFR.
Official compendial method.
Company method.
Sample is not tested immediately.
Sample is stored at ambient conditions and not tested immediately.
Sample is frozen and not tested immediately.
Sample is refrigerated and not tested immediately.
Sample is tested immediately.
ICH storage temperature, Q1A-Q1F.
Company defined.
WHO Technical Report Series, No.953, 2009. Stability testing of active pharmaceutical ingredients and finished pharmaceutical products.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Biological or Textual Reference to Actual Test or Parameter
CodeItem.stability_definition: Biological measurement or determination.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Chemical or Textual Reference to Actual Test or Parameter
CodeItem.stability_definition: Chemical measurement or determination.

CodeItem.nci_pt: Physical or Textual Reference to Actual Test or Parameter
CodeItem.stability_definition: Physical measurement or determination.
Stability data for a clinical lot.
Stability data for a commercial lot.
Stability data for a developmental lot.
